intro: Draba helleriana var. neomexicana, commonly known as the New Mexico rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with basal leaves and produces numerous small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh, dry climates and nutrient-poor substrates.
